properties.name: Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  1280 S Decatur Blvd Las Vegas NV 89102Dood! Ok, they always tell you that you can eat cheap but well in Vegas. Generally, this is not the case. Except here. Granted, I haven\'t had anything /but/ breakfast at Blueberry Hill, but I

properties.name: Japanese Car Service
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1843910 Spring Mountain Rd, Las Vegas NV 89102Growing up, my dad would fix all car problems I ever had. Well, short of dad, this place is the best. They\'re so very honest, the cost is reasonable, and they\'ve been able to revive my franken-car time and again.

properties.name: Lied Library
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184 4505 Maryland Pkwy Las Vegas NV 89154Being a student, I spend a lot of time in libraries, and, well, I consider myself an expert at finding good "spots" to hunker down and study. Lied library\'s best spot is the fifth floor. You get a swell view of Vegas through these huge windows, there are comfy chairs, and places to plug in your laptop, should you have it with you. There\'s also a coffee shop on the first floor, but the food ain\'t so great. . .you might want to bring your own.

properties.name: Metro Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1844001 South Decatur Blvd Las Vegas NV 89103You know, there isn\'t a lot of good pizza in this city. Except here. They have both New York and Chicago styles, and both are yummy.

properties.name: Neon Boneyard
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184821 Las Vegas Blvd N, Las Vegas NV 89101Ever wonder what happens to neon signs when nobody loves them anymore? Some of them end up here. The Boneyard is a bunch of retired signs strewn around an otherwise empty lot. Even though that doesn\'t sound so exciting, actually, you should go see it.

properties.name: Red Rock Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Red Rock Canyon National Conservation AreaI\'m more about parks and nature than casinos, so Red Rock is my cup of tea. It\'s close to Vegas, and out of town visitors get a good idea of desert landscape from it. Plus, if you hike the Children\'s Discovery Trail. . .theres totally this lone pine tree that smells like butterscotch. For real.

properties.name: The Artful Potter
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184   8825 South Eastern Suite 114 Las Vegas NV 89123If you\'re a crafty type, you can pick out and paint your own pottery here. They have lots of quirky little things to work on, and the staff is super nice and helpful.

properties.name: The Atomic Testing Museum
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  755 East Flamingo Road Las Vegas NV 89119Nevada has a semi-long and, erm, glorious history as an atomic test site. Find out more about it at this museum. And, for the particularly nerdy types, once a month you can tour the (still active) weapons test site 65 miles north of the city. Woot!

properties.name: The Cupcakery
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1849680 S. Eastern Ave. Suite 100 Henderson, NVBest cupcakes you will ever eat. Period. Lots of unusual flavor combinations, too.

properties.name: The District
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  2240 Village Walk Drive, Henderson Nevada 89052Ok. Just to shoot straight with you: Vegas really doesn\'t have a lot of cultural activities. Yet. But The District is making an attempt, and I give them mad kudos for it. Every so often, this shopping area hosts free festivals and concerts. You can check their website for a schedul of events. And, the shopping is pretty good too.

properties.name: The Fix
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1842031 W Sunset Rd, Henderson, NV 89014This is, like, church Vegas style. The Fix is associated with the Assemblies of God, and offers alternative rock worship music on Sunday mornings. Service is held at the E-String bar and grill at 11:00am. But you should come early, because it fills up fast.

properties.name: The Grand Lux Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  3355 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV 89109The Grand Lux is inside the Venetian Hotel And Casino. It\'s pretty standard Cheescake Factory type food, with the exception of The Grand Appetizer Platter. It. Is. Awesome. Anytime I have visitors, I try to make sure they try it. It\'s huge, you get really, really good (and slightly unusual) food, and it costs only about 5 for four people.

properties.name: Valley of Fire State Park
properties.description: Posted by Lxk184  Valley of Fire, NVThe Valley of Fire is so easy to get to from Vegas. Just take the I-15 North for about an hour. There are lots of interesting rock formations, and I highly recommend you hike Mouse\'s Tank.
